```{r setup, include=FALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = FALSE)
pacman::p_load('ggplot2', 'plotly')
```

#look at year, state, pesticide, carcinogen, bee toxin
what pesticides do each state use and how toxic are they?


```{r}
Plot <- ggplot(strawbPesti) + geom_point(aes (x= State, y= `Chemical Name`, color= `Human Toxins`)) + labs(title= 'How Toxic are the chemicals on strawberries for humans?')
ggplotly(Plot)
#add a note about how we determined human toxins
```
```{r}
Plot1 <- ggplot(strawbPesti) + geom_point(aes (x= State, y= `Chemical Name`, color= `Bee Toxins`)) + labs(title= 'How Toxic are the chemicals on strawberries for bees?')
ggplotly(Plot1)
```
